history.content:
*** DEADLINE: November 29 at noon ***


EE16B is looking for lab assistants, readers, and all kinds of TAs! If you're interested in joining course staff next semester, please fill out this form. We will hold interviews after the form deadline. If you have any questions/concerns, you can email Jessie Yang or Arda Sahiner (emails on 16B course website).


Here are some great reasons to join course staff for EE16B:

  • It's a great way to give back to the series. The course could not run without our wonderful readers and lab assistants, and we can always use more!
  • Being a lab assistant is a crucial part in the success of the course because the labs are such an important part of the series. You will attend a 2-hour training each week and then assist in lab for ~3 hours a week. By assisting, you sharpen your EE lab skills and gain a deeper understanding of the course material.
  • Being a reader is a great way to keep up with the content, working with TAs on debugging assignments as well as grading.
  • Being a reader or lab assistant is the first step to becoming a TA for the course in the future!
  • As a TA, you learn how to teach and improve your leadership. You also get to explore the material more by leading sections and/or creating course content.
  • It's a great way to keep using your EE knowledge and work with hands-on projects (did anyone say, robot car??)
  • You'll get P/NP course units or get paid!

The only prereq is that you've taken EE16A/16B.

TL;DR

  • Please fill out this form if you'd like to join EE16B course staff! https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScVJv5_qxVe5_UkGIVtG9Li3PirrbrmPkBkYZuou8ZT8u4OIA/viewform
  • Please also fill out the official application(s) to become a GSI/Reader/Tutor: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/gsis/prospective/applications

Thanks!!
Hope you join the 16B fam :)
history.subject: Join EE16B Course Staff!
